decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with artifacts like Black Lotus and Mishra's Workshop, while utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and return key pieces to your hand. The goal is to assemble the Time Vault combo with key pieces like Manifold Key and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, allowing you to take infinite turns and lock your opponent out of the game. Coveted Jewel serves as an additional win condition by drawing you cards and generating mana, while Force of Will and other disruption spells help protect your combo.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, most notably Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The strategy involves controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will and card advantage from spells like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. Show and Tell and Flash are used to put Atraxa or other threats into play quickly. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through powerful creature threats.

This deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. It also includes a variety of powerful spells like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Swords to Plowshares to control the game. The inclusion of cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Undercity Sewers add additional utility and resilience to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining control of the game state.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources while also utilizing powerful spells and artifacts to gain advantage. It combines counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm with other spells like Gifts Ungiven and Demonic Tutor to search for key cards. The inclusion of powerful mana sources like Black Lotus and Tolarian Academy allows for explosive plays. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, while also having access to combo potential with cards like Underworld Breach and Brain Freeze.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using artifacts like Mana Crypt and Mishra's Workshop to power out big spells like Coveted Jewel and Paradoxical Outcome. It utilizes powerful cards like Time Vault and Ancestral Recall to control the game and dig for essential combo pieces. With access to cards like Tinker and Tezzeret, the deck can tutor for key artifacts and assemble powerful synergies to overwhelm the opponent. By generating large amounts of mana and drawing cards efficiently, the deck can set up explosive turns and win the game through a combination of card advantage and powerful artifacts.

The key strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while utilizing powerful card draw and selection like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Ponder. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion. The deck also features disruptive cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Psychic Frog to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes synergies with cards like Misty Rainforest and Mishra's Bauble for additional filtering and utility.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that disrupt the opponent, counter spells, and draw cards. The inclusion of Gifts Ungiven allows the player to search for key cards to further manipulate the game state. By including powerful Vintage staples such as Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while setting up for a win condition through card advantage and careful resource management. The deck also includes an Underworld Breach package to provide additional combo potential if needed.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly through aggressive artifact creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy with disruptive permanents like Wasteland, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere. The deck also aims to generate additional value from artifacts with cards like Mystic Forge and Karn, the Great Creator. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient artifact creatures, prison effects, and mana denial to secure victory in the early turns of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional advantage by recurring low-cost permanents. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruptive plays, card advantage, and efficient threats, ultimately grinding out the opponent for a victory.

The deck focuses on using Paradoxical Outcome as a key combo piece to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, allowing the player to quickly assemble win conditions like Tinker into Bolas's Citadel or Time Vault. The deck includes a mix of fast mana, disruptive spells like Force of Will, and powerful tutors to find the necessary pieces. Using card draw and recursion effects, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and overwhelm them with a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly and efficiently bring back creatures such as Ichorid, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By continuously milling through the deck with cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp, the player is able to trigger powerful effects like Creeping Chill and Hollow One. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and graveyard synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's plays while generating card advantage through card draw and recursion. The inclusion of powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, along with the added flexibility of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, allows the deck to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield and outmaneuver the opponent. Additionally, cards like Demonic Tutor and Dig Through Time provide additional consistency and options for finding key pieces to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a lock on the opponent's resources by utilizing disruptive artifacts such as Trinisphere, Null Rod, and Sphere of Resistance. The deck aims to generate mana efficiently with cards like Mishra's Workshop and Sol Ring, allowing for fast deployment of threats like Lodestone Golem and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also leverages powerful utility lands like Strip Mine and Bojuka Bog to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Stonecoil Serpent and Patchwork Automaton.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with artifacts, utilizing cards like Mishra's Workshop, Grim Monolith, and The One Ring to quickly ramp up and overwhelm the opponent. It also leverages powerful artifacts such as Sol Ring, Time Vault, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to establish board control and finish the game swiftly. With a strong mana base and key support cards like Trinisphere and Sensei's Divining Top, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while consistently applying pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on deploying disruptive creatures known as "Hatebears" to hinder opponents' strategies while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive gameplay. By using cards like Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Seasoned Dungeoneer, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' mana base and spells while attacking with efficient creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. The inclusion of cards like Void Mirror and Cavern of Souls helps to counter opposing spell-heavy strategies, making it difficult for opponents to cast spells effectively. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting opponent's game plan.

The main theme of this deck is to deploy powerful artifacts quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes artifact mana acceleration like Grim Monolith and Moxen to ramp up into threats like Tezzeret and Time Vault. Cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void help disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Inventors' Fair and Mystic Forge provide card advantage and selection. The deck's win condition revolves around using artifacts like The One Ring and Key to manipulate the game state and push for a quick victory through aggressive play.
